Service Details: - Acts as an essential resource for children and families living with vision loss, helping children who are blind or partially sighted grow into successful, confident adults- Services include helping teens prepare for their futures, explore their career interests and transition to post-secondary school; giving children the support they need to excel, like braille preparation, tactile learning sessions and peer programs; providing parents with educational materials, peer groups; access to local resources, and workshops on raising a child who is blind or partially sighted
Eligibility: Individuals with a visual impairment which cannot be corrected by ordinary lenses
Former Name: Canadian National Institute for the Blind
